frameDefinitions: An Agent initiates the beginning of an ongoing Activity in which he will be continuously involved. '' 'At the same time, city-states began to grow in influence on the southern Greek mainland.'
A Perceiver determines the Location of a Sought_entity within a Ground.
Authorities charge a Suspect, who is under suspicion of having committed a crime (the Charges), and take him/her into custody.'
An Entity survives a situation with some Support, which tends to be far below the accustomed or standard level expected.
An Entity is at a particular stage of its development.
A Self_mover begins a journey at a Source location, in a particular Directiongenerally setting out with an Intended_goal in mind.
frameExamples: At the same time, city-states <t>began</t> to grow in influence on the southern Greek mainland.
Kim <t>found</t> his hat on the far side.
The police <t>arrested</t> Harry on charges of manslaughter.
Harry <t>subsisted</t> on ramen and cheap beer through college.
The <t>Next Generation</t> Internet (NGI) Program has been successfully completed.
At about 1:00 in the morning, climbers <t>set out</t> for the summit.
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> that an <fen>Agent</fen> starts.
This role identifies the being that starts the intentional <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.
The individual that determines the <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> succeeds in finding.
The position of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The general set of entities that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> examined in order to find the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Sought_entity</fen> is located.
<fen>Charges</fen> identifies a category within the legal system; it is the crime with which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is charged.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> charge the <fen>Suspect</fen> with commiting a crime, and take him/her into custody.
The <fen>Suspect</fen> is taken into custody, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
<fen>Offense</fen> identifies the ordinary language use of the reason for which a <fen>Suspect</fen> is arrested.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the arrest occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the arrest occurs.
The living organism which requires the <fen>Support</fen> to survive.
The resource that the <fen>Entity</fen> relies on to survive through a situation.
The object that has reached a particular stage of its development.
The time at which the progress occurs.
This is the entity which moves under its own power.

Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
The time at which the motion takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
listRoleExamples: <fex>I</fex> finally found the peanut underneath the couch cusion.
Sam located the Imperial regal <fex>among the coins in his pocket</fex> and passed it to the boy.
The police arrested Harry <fex>on charges of manslaughter</fex>.
<fex>The police</fex> arrested Harry on charges of manslaughter.
The police arrested <fex>Harry</fex> on charges of manslaughter.
The police arrested Harry <fex>on Wednesday afternoon</fex>.
The police arrested Harry <fex>in front of his house</fex>.
<fex>He</fex> lived on peanuts until she came along.
Harry managed to subsist <fex>on ramen and cheap beer</fex> through college.
We offer advice for very advanced <fex>learners of English</fex> on the different EFL/ESL exams.
